did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Music manuscripts, correspondence, and recordings relating to the life and work of Boris Koutzen.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Boris Koutzen (1901-1966) was born in Uman, Southern Russia, 1 April 1901. He began composing and studying the violin as a young child, and launched his career as a concert violinist at the age of eleven. His musical education began under his father's tutelage, but in 1918 the family moved to Moscow so Boris could study with Leo Zetlin and Reinhold Gli√®re at the Moscow Conservatory. While a student at the conservatory, Koutzen won the position of first violin in the State Opera House Orchestra, and played for the Moscow Symphony Orchestra under Serge Koussevitzky. Koutzen graduated from the Moscow Conservatory in 1921, studied and played in Germany for two years, then moved to the United States in 1923. His career in the U.S. included playing for the Philadelphia Orchestra under Leopold Stokowski (1924-1927), heading the violin department of the Philadelphia Conservatory (1924-1961), and playing for the NBC Orchestra under Arturo Toscanini (1937-1945). In 1944 he joined the faculty of Vassar College, where he taught violin and conducted the Vassar Orchestra until June 1966. He also taught at Bard College from 1949-1951. Koutzen died of a heart attack 10 December 10 1966 at the age of 65.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of music manuscripts, correspondence, recordings, and other materials relating to the life and work of Boris Koutzen.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Encoded by Laura Streett, March 2010. Last updated by Emma Gronbeck, September 2025.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by the Vassar College Music Library. Updated by Sarah Canino, January 2010. Updated by Laura Streett, February 2011. Last updated by Emma Gronbeck, September 2025.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Transferred from the Vassar College Music Library, 2010.
Materials in Series V were transferred from the Vassar College Music Library, 2025. [M2025-013]

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Original gift from Nadia Koutzen with later accessions in 1999, 2002 and 2010.
Materials in Series V were the gift of Angelika Forndran, 2021, and the Koutzen family.

altformavail.head: Other Formats
altformavail.p: Series II. "Recordings" has been digitized and the recordings are available to listen to online at the Vassar College Digital Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Boris Koutzen Papers, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

scopecontent.p: This series contains materials related to Koutzen's musical compositions, including drafts, proofs, published copies of scores and librettos.
Arranged alphabetically by composition title with miscellaneous compositions filed at the end of the sequence.
